meanings.definition: To unite in a league or alliance
meanings.sent1: The countries were confederating to fight against a common enemy.
meanings.sent2: The students were confederating to organize a charity event.
meanings.sent3: The animals were confederating to plan a surprise party for the zookeeper.
meanings.sent4: The stars were confederating in the night sky, forming beautiful constellations.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces were confederating together to reveal the complete picture.

meanings.sent1: The workers were confederating to demand better working conditions.
meanings.sent2: The community was confederating to clean up the neighborhood park.
meanings.sent3: The toys were confederating to come up with a plan to escape the toy box.
meanings.sent4: The rivers were confederating to create a powerful force of nature.
